thread.title: Never Shane: NZ First members oppose political return of Shane Jones
thread.title_full: Never Shane: NZ First members oppose political return of Shane Jones

author: Sam Sachdeva
title: Never Shane: NZ First members oppose political return of Shane Jones
text:
"His personal background as a politician is so diametrically opposed to our values in NZ First, we just don't see how he could conceivably fit in." VIRGINIA WOOLF/FAIRFAX NZ 
Shane Jones is seen by some as a candidate to replace NZ First leader Winston Peters when he retires. 
Jones' advocacy for the Trans Pacific Partnership free trade deal, and his decision as Immigration Minister to approve the citizenship application of controversial Chinese businessman William Yan, were both examples of his poor judgement, Rolinson said. 
"To top it all off, he abandoned his own party in its hour of need...to basically feather his own nest as a South Pacific ambassador for the National Party. 
"Really, we just can't trust him, that's our perspective on it." 
The group had started a letter-writing campaign to NZ First's board of directors, which would need to approve Jones' candidacy given he did not appear to be a party member. Ad Feedback 
Rolinson, who was the subject of an internal party complaint in 2013 and charged with cannabis possession in 2015, said the group was "not a one-man band", with many NZ First members concerned about Jones. 
"From everybody I've talked to, we're talking dozens and dozens of people, I'm yet to hear anybody say anything actually positive...so it's about making sure those people actually have their voices and their concerns heard." 
Some current NZ First MPs and board members were also worried about Jones, Rolinson claimed, although he would not name them. 
JONES: NO WAITANGI ANNOUNCEMENT 
Jones said he did not want to comment about the Facebook page, or whether he was a member of NZ First. However, he ruled out any announcement of a political comeback at his Waitangi Day party, saying it was about "simple hospitality". 
"There will most certainly be no announcements from myself on anything to do with politics." 
NZ First leader Winston Peters said "the source in the NZ First Leader's Office is no source at all" in reference to claims by Rolinson the media had a source there. 
Jones was a Labour MP for nine years, serving as Immigration Minister, Trade Minister and Building Minister. 
In 2010, he was forced to admit to using his Crown credit card to rent pornographic films while at hotels on government business, apologising and describing himself as a "red-blooded, robust dude". 
He made an unsuccessful bid for the Labour leadership in 2013, before jumping ship ahead of the 2014 election to take up a Pacific economic ambassador role created by Foreign Minister Murray McCully. 
But that contract ends in May and he does not plan to renew it - opening the way for him to link up with his old friend Peters. - Stuff
